pullRequest.title: GH-2104 explain query (query plan) API design and initial implementation
pullRequest.bodyText:
GitHub issue resolved: #2104 
Briefly describe the changes proposed in this PR:


PR Author Checklist:

 my pull request is self-contained
 I've added tests for the changes I made
 every commit message starts with the issue number (GH-xxxx) followed by a meaningful description of the change
 every commit has been signed off

Note: we merge all feature pull requests using squash and merge. See RDF4J git merge strategy for more details.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -12,18 +12,18 @@
 /**
  * A query on a repository that can be formulated in one of the supported query languages (for example SeRQL or SPARQL).
  * It allows one to predefine bindings in the query to be able to reuse the same query with different bindings.
- * 
+ *
  * @author Arjohn Kampman
  * @author jeen
  */
 public interface Query extends Operation {
 
 	/**
 	 * The different types of queries that RDF4J recognizes: boolean queries, graph queries, and tuple queries.
-	 * 
+	 *
 	 * @since 3.2.0
 	 */
-	public enum QueryType {

nodes.bodyText: all interface methods are public by definition
New explain method, enums and returned interface.
These are just placeholders for the time being.
This pretty much delegates to the sail connection in the same way as eveluate() does.

Implementation of getting the query plan.
A few things to note:

we use the evaluate() method to run the query instead of duplicating the code. We might need to duplicate it though since we need access to the evaluation strategy to enable tracking of result size when that gets merged in.
when using evaluate() it would clone tupleExpr, that had to be removed if we don't want to duplicate a lot of code
the code in Optimized is copied from evaluate, not sure if this is want
This is how it would be used.
Perhaps just call it QueryExplanation - wrapper is an implementation detail.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -44,21 +44,44 @@
 	/**
 	 * Specifies the maximum time that a query is allowed to run. The query will be interrupted when it exceeds the time
 	 * limit. Any consecutive requests to fetch query results will result in {@link QueryInterruptedException}s.
-	 * 
+	 *
 	 * @param maxQueryTime The maximum query time, measured in seconds. A negative or zero value indicates an unlimited
 	 *                     query time (which is the default).
 	 * @deprecated since 2.0. Use {@link Operation#setMaxExecutionTime(int)} instead.
 	 */
 	@Deprecated
-	public void setMaxQueryTime(int maxQueryTime);
+	void setMaxQueryTime(int maxQueryTime);
 
 	/**
 	 * Returns the maximum query evaluation time.
-	 * 
+	 *
 	 * @return The maximum query evaluation time, measured in seconds.
 	 * @see #setMaxQueryTime(int)
 	 * @deprecated since 2.0. Use {@link Operation#getMaxExecutionTime()} instead.
 	 */
 	@Deprecated
-	public int getMaxQueryTime();
+	int getMaxQueryTime();
+
+	// TODO - make default with no-op before merging to develop for backwards compatibility
+	// Also wondering if it makes sense to move this up a level to the Operation interface? Since we will be using a
+	// default no-op implementation we could move it without affecting backwards compatibility.
+	QueryExplainWrapper explain(QueryExplainLevel queryExplainLevel);
+
+	/**
+	 * The different types of queries that RDF4J recognizes: boolean queries, graph queries, and tuple queries.
+	 *
+	 * @since 3.2.0
+	 */
+	enum QueryExplainLevel {
+		Unoptimized,
+		Optimized,
+		Executed
+	}
+
+	interface QueryExplainWrapper {

nodes.bodyText:
There is a typo here: asHumanReadableString.
I think I'd prefer if we just used toString to render the object as a human-readable string, that's what it's for after all. We can add toString to the interface with some javadoc to make it clear that we expect it to provide a concise readable representation of the query plan (without going into detail of what that looks like).

nodes.bodyText: Fwiw we have that in quite a few of our interface. I don't think we've been very consistent with this throughout.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -12,18 +12,18 @@

  * A query on a repository that can be formulated in one of the supported query languages (for example SeRQL or SPARQL).

nodes.bodyText: I'd not want this in here anyway - we should hide the fact that we base it on a TupleExpr.

nodes.bodyText: If you move it up, we'll need a more generic name for the return type. We could just call it Explanation I guess, or else OperationExplanation. No real need for subtypes if they all do more or less the same thing anyway.

nodes.bodyText: I also think this interface should be top-level rather than nested in the Query interface. If we do that I'd also move the QueryExplanationLevel enum into it.

commit.message:
GH-2104 initial implementation for tuple queries

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

fixed typo

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

more null implementations

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

GH-2104 switch to toString

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

beforeCommit.message:
GH-2104 switch to toString

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

afterCommit.message:
GH-2104 switch to toString

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

commit.message:
formatting

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

GH-2104 track result size

moved interface

added our own object structure and json support

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

support ask and construct queries

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

renamed "as" to "to" since this is more common

default implementation

updated docs

quick fix for cloned tuple expr and also some cleanup of old code

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

cleaned up some interfaces while we are at it

timed queries

default implementation

various minor changes and also fix for wildcard in memory store stats

improved tests

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

fix test

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

timed explanations

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

docs

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

Merge branch 'develop' into GH-2104-retrieve-query-plan-api

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

formatting and marking as experimental

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

GH-2104 expose join algorithm

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

GH-2104 simple fix for locking issue and make sure we interrupt the interuption thread

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

more docs

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

Merge develop

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

more docs and possible fix for timedOut

more docs and cleanup

more cleanup
